hook.text: In 2005, the web had about 10 fonts. Today, Google Fonts alone offers over 1,500 â€” all free.

buildup.text: @font-face in CSS let websites load custom fonts. Before that, you were stuck with system defaults.

discovery.text: Web fonts download to the user's browser. File size matters â€” a heavy font slows the whole page.

twist.text: FOUT (Flash of Unstyled Text) happens when the page loads before the font. Users see a jarring swap.

climax.text: font-display: swap tells the browser to show fallback text immediately, then swap when the font loads.

punchline.text: Beautiful type means nothing if the page is too slow to read.
